item.description:
CHANCE OF SPRINKLES at 11 AM IS reportedly 1 in 3 according to my most reliable source:
http://www.timeanddate.com/weather/usa/boston/hourly

So put on your walking shoes, already!

CO-POSTED TO BOSTON CULTURAL NOMADS (46 already signed up there). FREE.


Tours of the lilacs, live music, food and picnicking from dawn to dusk with refreshments and activities from 10am to 4pm. This is the oldest public arboretum in North America, and it showcases over 180 varieties of lilacs! The best time to see these blooms is on Lilac Sunday, held since 1908 to exhibit the pinnacle of lilac perfection. Take guided tours of the gardens, then sit back with a refreshment and enjoy acoustic music, storytelling, and traditional English dancing.

Please sign up at 11:00 for the 11:30 tour leaving from the Hunnewell Lawn , leading to the Lilac Collection.
When you get to the Lilac Collection, we'll try & sign up for the 12:30 Lilac Collection tour leaving shortly thereafter.

For more details check the 2013 schedule--
http://arboretum.harvard.edu/news-events/lilac-sunday/

Here's a map you can print--
http://arboretum.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/Basic-map-b+w.pdf



Parking:
Street parking along the Arboretum perimeter is limited and visitors are advised to takeÂ public transportation--
http://arboretum.harvard.edu/visit/directions/
[Quinn E. says: I say this every year, but in case you didn't hear- DO NOT DRIVE TO THE ARBORETUM ON LILAC SUNDAY! Take the Orange Line (it's a short walk from Forest Hills) or the 39 bus. Trust me.]
item.how_to_find_us: Meet near the main gate (Arborway Gate), in front of the park office/ shop (Hunnewell center). It'll be crowded so Duncan (co-host) will be wearing a distinctive hat with a tiger puppet on top.
item.name: Meet the Lilacs at Arnold Arboreum
